text: I posted this on <#C6A044SQH|helpdesk>, but perhaps here is a better place. Does somebody know whether julia works on RHEL6?

elements.text: , but perhaps here is a better place. Does somebody know whether julia works on RHEL6?

text: I haven't tried it myself. But one of the engineers that I work with said that it didn't work out of the box. I will check with him later today, but I wanted to check with you guys in case it was known not to work.

elements.text: I haven't tried it myself. But one of the engineers that I work with said that it didn't work out of the box. I will check with him later today, but I wanted to check with you guys in case it was known not to work.

text:
Check how it was installed.
If it was from ta package manager that could cause it to be broken.
Package managers sometimes do things like force Julia to use the systems LLVM.
Which can break due to the fact that Julia comes with a patched LLVM.

elements.text:
Check how it was installed.
If it was from ta package manager that could cause it to be broken.
Package managers sometimes do things like force Julia to use the systems LLVM.
Which can break due to the fact that Julia comes with a patched LLVM.

text: He told me that he tried to install it using `yum` as specified on the julialang website and also downloaded the binary from the downloads section.

elements.text: He told me that he tried to install it using
as specified on the julialang website and also downloaded the binary from the downloads section.

text: I have to check what he actually did to be sure where he got stuck.

elements.text: I have to check what he actually did to be sure where he got stuck.

text: Quick update. I talked to the engineer and ss it happens he got stuck with the DEPOT because that machine doesn't have access to the internet. But I showed him how to copy packages from one DEPOT to another and now it works.

elements.text: Quick update. I talked to the engineer and ss it happens he got stuck with the DEPOT because that machine doesn't have access to the internet. But I showed him how to copy packages from one DEPOT to another and now it works.

text: I used to run Julia on CentOS6 a couple of years ago.  I always installed from .tar.gz as I didn't have root.
